title: In Japanese, what is the difference between では and には when the final verb is still ある? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yama niwa Yamaneko ga Imazu. In the mountain, there are some wlid cats. Yama dewa tenki ga yoku kawari masu. In the mountain, a climate often change rapidly. には often connects words in some place relations. では connects words alike its situations. we say, 電車の中には非常ベルがあります。 Densha no naka niwa hijyo bell ga arimasu. there is a emergency bell in the train. but, we don't tell 電車の中では非常ベルがあります。✖︎✖︎✖︎ Densha no naka dewa hijyo bell ga arimasu this isn't natural. but we say, 電車の中では席を譲り合うことは良いことです。 Densha no naka dewa seki wo yuzuri au kotowa yoi koto desu. it is a good manner to give a sheet each other on the train. and we never say, 電車の中には席を譲り合うことは良いことです。✖︎✖︎✖︎ Densha no naka niwa seki wo yuzuri au kotowa yoi koto desu. 「には 」 connects to some place relation words. 「では 」connects to some situation related words.
